comments:
N20060425-0010

When a tree selection has more than one path to the same element, and is compared to a tree selection with one path (or a diff number of paths) to the same element, an index out of bound exception ocurrs:

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 3

Can you provide the steps that lead you to this erroe? (i.e. muli-select 'x' and 'y' in Package Explorer etc)?
I created this probem using "experimental code" from the debugger that is not released to the build, so there are no steps to reproduce using the SDK. However, I may be able to formulate a test case.
Thanks, I think the description and the stack trace is sufficient.
*** Bug 140271 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

McQ, Michael, do you approve this fix? The patch includes a test case that reproduces the AIOOBE for the unpatched TreeSelection. This bug was introduced when we made TreeSelection a subclass of StructuredSelection - basically, size() can be smaller than getPaths().length if multiple equal leaf nodes are in the selection because size() is computed based on the (unique) elements in the structured selection, not based on the number of paths.
Patch released. Eric, can you make sure this goes into RC3? Thanks!
Verified for I20050512-0010 that the test method testBug1384558 is executed as part of the automated test suite and passes.
